sentence.Network_en: Her advice includes perfectly true but rather fulsome pearls of wisdom.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的建议中有完全正确的金玉良言，但有过于恭维之嫌。

sentence.Network_en: He was fulsome in his praise of the Prime Minister.
sentence.Network_cn: 他称赞首相时有溢美之词。

sentence.Network_en: They tried to please him with fulsome compliments and extravagant gifts.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们想用溢美之词和奢华的礼品来取悦他.

list.abs: send a small bag of money with a fulsome letter ., 给他送去一小袋钱.
However , fulsome pressure maybe take people to extremity , even giving up their life ., 然而 , 过大的压力可能会使人走向极端 , 甚至放弃人生.
i was disgusted by his fulsome flattery ., 我讨厌他那过分的谄媚.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'abundant'): from full + -some

entry.tran: (赞扬、道歉、感激等)虚伪的，夸张的，过度的
entry.def: If you describe expressions of praise, apology, or gratitude as fulsome, you disapprove of them because they are exaggerated and elaborate, so that they sound insincere.

example.ex: Newspapers have been fulsome in their praise of the former president.
example.tran: 报纸上对前总统都是些溢美之词。

means.word_mean: 1. unpleasantly and excessively suave or ingratiating in manner or speech;
